github.copilot.chat.commitMessageGenerat.text: Always use Conventional Commits format: <type>[optional scope]: <description>
Use these types accurately: build, ci, chore, docs, feat, fix, perf, refactor, revert, style, test
Include scope in parentheses after type when changes affect specific modules/components (ex: feat(auth): add login)
For multiple distinct changes, generate separate commit messages - one per logical change
Body text (if needed) starts on new line using imperative mood, separated by blank line from subject
Use bullet points with hyphens (-) for breaking changes or detailed explanations in body
Keep subject line under 72 characters, body lines under 100 characters max
Write in imperative mood ("add feature" not "added feature")

github.copilot.chat.pullRequestDescripti.text: Always generate a structured pull request description using the following sections: Summary, Key Changes, Motivation, Testing, and Additional Notes.
Always format Key Changes as a bullet list with at least 3-6 specific items.
Always write in a professional, concise, engineering-focused tone. Avoid marketing language such as 'robust', 'seamless', 'enhanced', or 'improved'.
Always explain why the change was made, not just what changed.
Always include testing instructions describing how reviewers can verify the changes.
Never collapse the entire description into a single paragraph.
